completedHtmlOnCondition.html:
Thank you for your feedback

We are glad that you love our product. Your ideas and suggestions will help us make it even better.

Thank you for your feedback

We are glad that you shared your ideas with us. They will help us make our product better.

elements.name: question1
elements.title: Q1: Which of the answers below best describe the primary activity of the applicant? (tick up to two)

choices.text: Sell a product/service
Fulfill a government task
Conduct applied research
Conduct basic research

elements.name: question2
elements.title: Q2: Which of the answers below best describe the financial structure of the applicant’s organisation? (tick up to two)

choices.text: Largely financed through income from own activities or parent/partner company
Largely financed by way of large donations (above 5000€ or equivalent per donation)
Largely financed by governments or international organisations
Largely financed by way of small donations (up to 5000€ or equivalent per donation)

elements.name: question3
elements.title: Q3: Which of the answers below best describe the applicant’s public reporting requirements? (tick one)

choices.text: No reporting requirements
Annual report on key financials to financial institution
Annual non-public report on activities to the funder (or other entities)
Annual report on activities to the public

elements.name: question4
elements.title: Q4: Which of the answers below best describe the applicant’s legal obligations to provide information to the public? (tick one)

choices.text: No legal options to compel disclosure of information about it data use activities to the public beyond civil or criminal proceedings
Can be compelled to disclose information about its data use activities via freedom of information laws

elements.name: question5
elements.title: Q5: Which of the answers below best describe the applicant’s track record in providing information about all its activities to the public? (tick one)

choices.text: Demonstrated track record of rejecting information requests (Irrespective of byway of FOI laws, other laws, or voluntarily)
No track record
Demonstrated track record of promptly responding to information requests (Irrespective of byway of FOI laws, other laws, or voluntarily)

elements.name: question6
elements.title: Q6: Which of the answers below best describe the applicant’s motivation for data use? (tick up to two)

choices.text: Develop/ improve new drug/ medical treatment
Combat climate change
Combat social and economic inequality

elements.name: question7
elements.title: Q7: Which of the answers below best describe the main beneficiary of the applicant’s data use? (tick one)

choices.text: Benefits accrue largely to the organisation
Benefits largely accrue to users of the product/service resulting from the data use
Benefits accrue to users and non-users of product/service resulting from data use

elements.name: question8
elements.title: Q8: Which of the answers below best describe the applicant’s track record in increasing the benefits of the applicant’s data use in the Global South? (tick one)

choices.text: No track record of adjusting the data use to expand the range of beneficiaries in the Global South
Track record of adjusting the data use to expand the range of beneficiaries in the Global South
Strong track record of adjusting the data use to expand the range of beneficiaries in the Global South

elements.name: question9
elements.title: Q9: Which of the answers below best describe the applicant’s track record in strengthening benefits of the applicant’s data use for groups that are granted additional protection by way of anti-discrimination law? (tick one)

choices.text: No track record of  strengthening benefits for groups that are granted additional protection by way of anti-discrimination law
Track record of strengthening benefits for groups that are granted additional protection by way of anti-discrimination law
Strong track record of strengthening benefits for groups that are granted additional protection by way of anti-discrimination law

elements.name: question10
elements.title: Q10: Which of the answers below best describe the applicant’s data use’s benefits for future generations? (tick up to two)

choices.text: Benefits primarily cover issues of current relevance
Benefits primarily cover issues of relevance for future generations
Benefits are likely to increase in the future

elements.name: question11
elements.title: Q11: Which of the answers below best describe risks entailed in the applicant’s data use? (tick as many as necessary)

choices.text: Physical risk
Financial risk
Informational risk

elements.name: question12
elements.title: Q12: Which of the answers below best describe effects of the applicant’s data use on the environment? (tick one)

choices.text: Environment is negatively impacted
Environment is positively impacted

elements.name: question13
elements.title: Q13: Which of the answers below best describe the relationship between the applicant’s data use and risks? (tick one)

choices.text: Risks stem directly from the applicant’s data use (direct cause)
Risks are incidental to the applicant’s data use (indirect cause)

elements.name: question14
elements.title: Q14: Which of the answers below best describe the risks for groups afforded special protection under the law (including, but not limited to, children, persons with disabilities, ethnic minorities, sexual minorities)? (tick one)

choices.text: Applicant’s data use entails risk for groups afforded special protection under the law
Applicant’s data use entails no risk for groups afforded special protection under the law

elements.name: question15
elements.title: Q15: Which of the answers below best describe the applicant’s communication about risks of its data to the public? (tick one)

choices.text: No information provided
Information about risks provided to the public at some point during the data use
Information about risks provided to the public prior to commencement of data use

elements.name: question16
elements.title: Q16: Which of the answers below best describe the risk of dual use (tick one)?

choices.text: Dual use is likely
Dual use is unlikely but conceivable
Dual use is extremely unlikely

elements.name: question17
elements.title: Q17: Which of the answers below best describe the likelihood of a risk of dual use materializing and creating harm (tick one)?

choices.text: Risk from dual use are likely to materialise
Risks from dual use are unlikely to materialise
Likelihood of risks from dual use cannot be assessed

elements.name: question18
elements.title: Q18: Which of the answers below best describe the applicant’s way of assessing risk (tick one)?

choices.text: No risk assessment in place
Ex ante institutionalized/ad-hoc risk assessment is voluntary
Ex ante institutionalized risk assessment is mandatory

elements.name: question19
elements.title: Q19: Which of the answers below best describe the applicant’s way of assessing risk? (tick one)

choices.text: No involvement of persons from outside the organisation
Occasional/Needs-based involvement of persons from outside the organisation
Routine involvement of persons from outside the organisation
No risk assessment in place

elements.name: question20
elements.title: Q20: Which of the answers below best describe the status of findings from the risk assessment? (tick one)

choices.text: Findings are recommendations
Findings are binding and cannot be overruled

elements.name: question21
elements.title: Q21: Which of the answers below best describe the involvement of trained ethicists in the process of assessing risks? (tick one)

choices.text: Trained ethicists are not included in the risk assessment
No risk assessment in place
Trained ethicists are included in the risk assessment
No risk assessment in place

elements.name: question22
elements.title: Q22: Which of the answers below best describe the process of harm monitoring? (tick one)

choices.text: No monitoring of harms
Harms monitored for a limited period during the data use and the deployment of the data use and the deployment of the product/service
Harms are monitored throughout the data use and the deployment of the product/service

elements.name: question23
elements.title: Q23: Which of the answers below best describe the ability of the applicant to stop/reverse their activity, once unexpected harms occur? (tick one)

choices.text: Harm-causing activity cannot be ended immediately
Harm-causing activity Harms can be ended immediately

elements.name: question24
elements.title: Q24: Which of the answers below best describe the remedies available to individuals? (tick as many as necessary)

choices.text: No complaint procedure in place
Complaint procedure can be initiated online
Complaint procedure designed in an accessible manner
Guaranteed respond times (under 4 weeks)
